column1: It was now well into October.Already the leaves had begun to turn scarlet and gold on some of the hedges
column3: where the boys were beginning to go for the early nuts. Early in the mornings there was a decided tang to the air that hinted at frost. Considerable talk was being indulged in whenever a group of boys came together
column4: concerning the prospects for a regular old-fashioned winter
column5: and many hopes along this line were indulged in.There was a good reason for this
column6: Chester being most favorably situated to afford her young people a chance to enjoy ice sports when the bitter weather came along. Right at her door lay beautiful Lake Constance
column7: several miles across; and the intake at the upper end near the abandoned logging camp was the crooked and picturesque Paradise River
column8: where wonderful vistas opened up with each hundred yards
column9: did any one care to skate up its course for miles.
